subject: Re: [junit] Object comparison using assertEquals
msgSnippet: ... Incorrect. It uses the equals method. What the equals method is up to who wrote the classes whose objects are compared. ... Implement equals on the class
messageBody:
>So said kartikdg on 2003-05-20 --------------------
>Hi,
>I would like to deep compare 2 objects (expectedResult and
>actualResult)
>using JUnit.
>
>JUnit provides an interface called assertEquals(Object o1, Object o2)
>which compares 2 obects by reference and does not perform a deep
>comparison.

Incorrect. It uses the equals method. What the equals method is up to who wrote the classes whose objects are compared.

>Since the expectedResult and actualResult will never have the same
>reference, does anyone have any idea on how to perform a deep
>comparison comparing the values of 2 objects) ?

Implement equals on the class under test.


J. B. Rainsberger,
President, Diaspar Software Services
